Sequence Information.Peptide Name: hBD10 (human beta-defensin 10, hBD-10; UCSS1a; natural AMPs; primates, mammals, animals; 3S=S)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: Originally predicted by Schutte et al. (2002)PNAS99:2129-2133.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (35%) tomBD-12. Mol Wt: 4075.706; GRAVY: -0.84; Mol formula: C164H272N56O51S6, Molar Ex Coeff: 1865.Activity: Active against S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 25 uM), E. coli ATCC 25922 (25 uM),  M. tuberculosis  H37Rv (MIC 11.8 uM), and M. tuberculosis MDR (MIC 5.9 uM) (anti-TB). In culture broth, it only showed a bacteriostatic effect.Toxicity: human RBC: not hemo.lytic (<2%) at 100 ug/ml.Updated 7/2021; 11/2023
Literature Information.Author: Rodriguez A, Pedersen MÃ˜, Villegas E, Rivas-Santiago B, Villegas-Moreno J, Amero C, Norton RS, Corzo G. 2019
Literature Information.Title: Antimicrobial activity and structure of a consensus human beta-defensin and its comparison to a novel putative hBD10
